events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a rear-end collision involving their vehicle, resulting in significant bumper damage.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and police documentation submitted.
An agent was assigned to the case to manage communications and follow up on claim processing steps.
Customer received an acknowledgment notification stating their auto accident claim is under review.
The insurer requested additional documents, including vehicle repair estimates and the police accident report.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos of vehicle damage and repair quotes.
Investigation began to verify liability, damage extent, and review related traffic camera footage as part of claim process.
Investigation concluded confirming fault was with the other driver, and damage estimate was verified as accurate.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the claimant.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the efficient handling of the claim.
Claim was officially approved, confirming the payout to be processed shortly in favor of the insured.
Payment for the vehicle repairs and related expenses was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account promptly.
The auto accident claim was closed following the successful payment and confirmation of vehicle repairs completed.
All documentation and claim files were securely archived for record-keeping and future reference as required.
